intro: Isocarpha eupatorioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters. Isocarpha eupatorioides is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
